SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Deliver a Faster Cart Experience to Storefront Users

The Shopping Cart page version 2.0 optimizes server-side queries to cart data. Optimization reduces the overall volume of operations for populating the page. On the front end, the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 eliminates expensive UI transforms. The Shopping Cart version 2.0 provides the same user experience as version 1.0, but with faster data retrieval and quicker response times.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Compared to the Shopping Cart page version 1.0, version 2.0 loads the following data more quickly:

Attribute-driven commerce
Aggregated products
Assembly products
Bundles, kits, and dynamic kits
Tiered pricing
Subscriptions

Compared to the Shopping Cart page version 1.0, version 2.0 responds more quickly when a storefront user clicks the following buttons:

Update Cart
Email Cart
Checkout
Create Wishlist
Add Comments

How: After you upgrade the available global data, the Cart module’s Use Cart Page 2.0 configuration setting is available and TRUE by default.

If you previously extended the Shopping Cart page version 1.0, migrate your extensions to the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 where necessary.

NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce continues support for the Shopping Cart page version 1.0. To revert, change the Use Cart Page 2.0 configuration setting to FALSE.
SEE ALSO
Shopping Cart Page Extensions for Version 2.0
